actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop('SalePrice', axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values
numerical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
categorical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numerical_imputer, numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', categorical_imputer),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ])

# Train model
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

# Fit model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
X_test = test_df.copy()
X_test = preprocessor.transform(X_test)
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop('SalePrice', axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values and encode
X_train = X_train.copy()
X_test = test_df.copy()

# Fill missing values in numerical columns with median
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(X_test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure columns are aligned
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop('SalePrice', axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numerical columns with median
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test = test_df.copy()
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(X_test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)

# Ensure columns are aligned
X_train_encoded, X_test_encoded = X_train_encoded.align(X_test_encoded, join='left', axis=1)

# Train model
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train_encoded, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test_encoded)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop('SalePrice', axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numerical columns with median

X_test = test_df.copy()
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(X_test[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X_train_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
X_test_encoded = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_columns, drop_first=True)
